TEXT: The applicant [ Mr PERSON ] is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . Before the ORG he was represented by PERSON , of ORG .
The facts , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG of ORG ( the autonomous regional government ) drew up a non - compliance report on the applicant on the ground that as the lessor of a number of business LOC he had failed to deposit with ORG , as required by the provisions of the Junta ’s Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE , the sums corresponding to the statutory securities paid to him by his tenants , a total of MONEY .

By a decision of DATE the ORG ordered the applicant to deposit the sum corresponding to the securities and to pay a fine of the same amount . He was informed that in the event of failure to comply notice - to - pay proceedings would be brought against him for recovery of the debt ( recaudación por vía de apremio ) .

The applicant appealed against the above decision to ORG arguing in particular that the obligation to deposit sums equivalent to the securities with a public institution in the form of a deposit without interest breached LAW , which guarantees the right of property and to peaceful enjoyment of possessions , and LAW , which guarantees the principle of equality before the law . By a judgment of DATE , served on the applicant on DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal , holding , firstly , that the general interest and the social dimension of the right to housing justified certain inequalities with regard to leases , and secondly that the social function of the right of property could also justify restrictions on the right to dispose of certain possessions , regard being had to the fact that the funds thus deposited were used to finance housing policy .

The applicant lodged a recurso de amparo with ORG , appealing against the above judgment and alleging in particular the breach of ORG CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( right to a fair hearing ) , CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( principle that offences and penalties must be defined by law ) and QUANTITY ( right to peaceful enjoyment of possessions ) of the Spanish Constitution . By a decision of DATE , served on the applicant on DATE , ORG dismissed this appeal . With regard to the complaint of an infringement of the right to peaceful enjoyment of possessions ( LAW ) , it observed that , according to LAW ( b ) of the LAW and section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW on ORG , the right protected by LAW was not one of those which could form the subject of a recurso de amparo . As regards the complaints under LAW and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW , ORG ruled that they were manifestly ill - founded .
“ CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court shall have jurisdiction throughout NORP territory and it is empowered to hear :
( b ) individual appeals for protection ( amparo ) on account of infringement of the rights and freedoms contemplated in LAW in the cases and the forms prescribed by law ;

“ CARDINAL . The rights and freedoms set forth in ORG DATE LAW may form the subject of a recurso de amparo in the cases and the forms defined by the present LAW ... Identical protection shall be afforded to the right to conscientious objection recognised in LAW .
